messages: 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:06): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Okay, that sounds reasonable
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:06): knows pretty much nothing about XSD, and so probably can't be of much help now

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:09): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: fwiw, re-enabling XSD is a one-character change and recompile, so if you've already got a copy of the source tree, the line to uncomment is #com.thaiopensource.validate.xerces.XsdSchemaReaderFactory in onvdl/src/META-INF/services/com.thaiopensource.validate.SchemaReaderFactory
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:13): doesn't have a copy of the source tree
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:13): wonders if it's trivial to install
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:14): tries the easy-looking installation commands
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:24): "Bad MD5 hash for http://mirror.eunet.fi/apache/xml/xalan-j/xalan-j_2_7_0-bin.zip"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:25): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: hmm. the apache mirrors are annoyingly unreliable. I should add a check for 4xx responses
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:25): Hmm, I can't easily delete the file and try to download it again, because I've got no idea where the downloader saves it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:26): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: can you see if the downloaded file looks like a zip or like an HTML error page?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:26): in dependencies/
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:27): There's no dependencies/xalan* - maybe it didn't save it anywhere. I get a 404 if I try that address in a web browser
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:27): Looks like they only have 2.7.1 now
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:30): it's annoying that the mirrors don't keep old versions
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:30): I just discovered that the Inkscape docs do not completely describe Inkscape's SVG extensions
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:31): I guess it's sensible to delete the old versions if the new version fixes security vulnerabilities, though I have no idea if that's relevant in this case
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:32): I'm starting to wonder if trying to build specific support for Inkscrape extensions is a bad idea after all
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:32): everything is harder than it first appears...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:33): haha. the unknown attribute that I find is documented to be INTERNAL USE ONLY; never serialized
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:33): yeah, right

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:34): I'm not sure who would find specific Inkscape support helpful - I would just want the validator to accept documents I exported from Inkscape and maybe modified by hand a little, and I wouldn't care about any details in the Inkscape-specific sections
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:35): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: I'm not checking the values of Inkscape attributes or anything, but I made a whitelist instead of allowing anything
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:36): s/anything/everything/ in the last instance

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:39): A whitelist allowing inkscape:* and sodipodi:* would allow the things I'd want it to allow (i.e. documents exported from past/current/future versions of Inkscape), and wouldn't miss any errors that I would make and would want to be warned about (because I'm not going to be writing/modifying things in Inkscape's namespaces)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:40): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: would you allow those on XHTML elements and MathML, too?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:40): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: would you allow <sodipodi:namedview/> outside <defs>?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:41): (the way I'm rationalizing this effort is that that inkscape cruft seems to be a pretty common issue)

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:44): I guess I don't see why it would hurt to allow them, since interoperability is irrelevant for product-specific extensions like these... That sounds like a potentially dangerous view, though
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:45): aside: IDness sucks. Chemical Markup Language is smart to avoid IDness.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:45): I think it's a bad idea, though, that CML's non-ID is called id
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:45): so inkscape doesn't use globally unique IDs
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:46): so when a single XHTML page includes two Inkscape drawings, their IDs will collide
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:46): but I guess I should report that as an error, given specs and all

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:47): I can't think of a good reason to accept Inkscape-specific elements/attributes scattered through a document, but not accept e.g. MS Office's HTML-with-namespaces exporter's elements/attributes scattered through a document
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (15:48): i think accepting either is potentially harmful
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:48): but the latter sounds like something that shouldn't be accepted for documents published on the web, so I'm not sure why the former would be accepted

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:50): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: I don't have an exactly good feeling about allowing the Inkscape cruft by default, but is it really useful to whine to authors about it?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:50): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: what's the harm?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (15:51): the SVG would do different things in inkscape versus other editors
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:51): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Is there a standard way to combine documents with potentially-conflicting IDs?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:51): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: not to my knowledge
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (15:51): which might force other editors to support their stuff
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:52): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: would it be bad if the Inkscape stuff became the de facto way of storing certain editing state in SVG?

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:52): has had roughly that issue with X3D-plus-some-extensions, e.g. importing a file with some meshes and then referring to an ID in that file in order to animate it
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (15:52): about as bad as <apple-canvas> becoming the de facto way of doing <canvas> on the Web
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:53): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: I see your point
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:54): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: still, it seems user-unfriendly to pretend that commonly-used extensions didn't exist

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (15:54): (Currently I've got something like <Inline DEF="a" url="some file with an element 'b'"/> and then you can use an almost-IDREF like "a b" to access the nested elements without conflicts)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:57): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: what's your take on http://intertwingly.net/blog/2007/11/16/Whitelisting#c1195315674 ?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (15:58): maybe you could make some widely used stuff a stron warning
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (15:59): tries to fetch the page, should actually go

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:59): and, yeah, if MS Office exported XHTML5 + namespaced extensions, I guess I should seriously consider supporting it on some level that keeps the validator useful for Office users

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:00): I don't think vendor-extensions are that great (long term) and all other types of extensions really should be coordinated (although it should be easy to get them in the spec if people agree it's a good thing) as we see with SQL storage, etc.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:01): I have to go now

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:05): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: (writing to log in case you read it when you come back): I agree that extensions should be coordinated and done without vendor namespaces ideally. However, Inkscape is using the extension mechanism that the SVG spec blesses

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:20): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I get various messages like "./syntax/non-schema/java/src/org/whattf/checker/TextContentChecker.java:27: package org.relaxng.datatype does not exist" that look like missing dependencies
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:22): (after modifying build.py to get xalan-j_2_7_1 instead of xalan-j_2_7_0)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:23): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: that's weird. did onvdl compile successfully?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:23): that is, is there a file at jars/onvdl-whattf.jar ?
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:24): There is a file there

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:24): If I run 'build' again, the first reported error is "./onvdl/src/nu/validator/relaxng/exceptions/UnfinishedElementException.jav./onvdl/src/com/thaiopensource/validate/SchemaReaderLoader.java:7: package org.apache.xalan.processor does not exist"
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:25): which probably makes sense
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:25): because I manually downloaded xalan-j_2_7_1-bin.zip and it probably expects that file to be unpacked
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:26): Looks a bit happier now
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:26): (I don't know whether you can easily check that the dependency got unpacked properly)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:26): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: the build script has a Python array of dependency jars.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:27): Does anyone want to suggest wording for a warning about product-specific extensions?
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:28): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: It seems ro run successfully now
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:29): Also, can someone suggest a practical content model for foreignObject in the XHTML+SVG+MathML case?
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:30): org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: No implementation available for schema language with namespace URI ‚Äúhttp://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema‚Äù
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:30): ...is what it says by default when trying to use XSD
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:31): (before telling the user "The document validates according to the specified schema(s).")
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:31): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: HTML <html> or <div>, or MathML <math>
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:31): (though HTML5 currently says only <html> would be allowed, i think)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:32): thinks <div> should be allowed as root
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:32): notes that Atom uses <div>
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:32): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: yeah, currently only <html>

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:35): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: is needing a <div> there a cargo cult of do SVG impls break if foreignObject has more than one XHTML block element as children?
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:37): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: That thingy for enabling XSD seems to work correctly
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:37): though its error messages are totally useless
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:37): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: then what's left is making sure that it uses the right EntityResolver
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:38): Error: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-schema-1#cvc-complex-type.3.2.2?X3D&width
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:38): From line 1, column 1; to line 5, column 52
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:38): (is what it says for <X3D width>, given that width is not an allowed attribute)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:39): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: haven't tested multiple children
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:39): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: weren't URI-identified errors supposed to be coolest thing around? :-)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:39): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: i'd be fine with other elements as root as well
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:40): (or multiple roots for that matter)
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:40): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: They tempt me to copy the URI into my address bar, and then taunt me by giving a 404
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:40): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: the SVG 1.1 spec uses <body>...
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:41): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: i see little reason to disallow it :)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:42): except that it makes the "contexts in which this element is allowed" more complex
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:42): allowing any block or <html> as root seems like a simpler rule
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:42): now needs to learn enough about XML Schema to move all the elements into a namespace and add some extensions
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:43): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: Jing/oNVDL doesn't interfere with those messages. There's only Xerces to blame
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:43): wonders if there's a human-friendly error renderer in Xerces somewhere
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:43): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I've used Xerces-C++, so I'm happy to blame it for many things :-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:46): hmm. the W3C SVG 1.1 schema allows non-whitespace text node children in foreignObject. isn't that bogus?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:46): also, it allows <svg> there. isn't that bogus too as non-foreign?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:49): is it just me or is foreignObject seriously underdefined in SVG 1.1?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:50): what's the deal with SVG 1.2 Full not having a public WD since 13 April 2005?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:50): I thought SVG 1.1 Full was about to go to CR
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:54): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: i thought they worked on 1.2 Tiny
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:55): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: oh? http://www.w3.org/TR/SVGMobile12/ says "Candidate Recommendation" for me
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:55): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: oh right. I misread
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:55): saw the capital R and forgot to read more to the left
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:55): removes the code that disallows connections to localhost
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:58): How are you meant to use IPv6 host addresses in HTTP URIs? http://::1/ is going to get confused with the port number syntax
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:59): or something like that
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (17:01): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Does that mean http://validator.nu/?doc=http%3A%2F%2F%5B%3A%3A1%5D%2F should be forbidden?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:02): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: the localhost banning code is a broken tinfoil hat
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:02): I tried to google for foreignObject demos but they are remarkably few in the top hits
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (17:04): (Wow, IPv6 actually works on my local computer)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:04): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: do you get routing to the outside world as well?
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (17:05): $ ping6 ietf.org
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (17:05): connect: Network is unreachable
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:07): if <foreignObject><div> is only a cargo cult, it is a strong one
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:07): I don't like this. I wanted to see a proper spec for how foreignObject establishes a nested CSS rendering context
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (17:10): (Hmm, it looks like the university network supports IPv6, but the CS department's network doesn't)
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (17:10): (which seems a bit odd)
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (17:10): (given that there are people here who do networky stuff)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:11): Jacques Distler has a use case for SVG in <annotation-xml>: http://golem.ph.utexas.edu/~distler/blog/archives/001475.html
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (17:16): <xs:schema targetNamespace="http://www.web3d.org/specifications/x3d-namespace" xmlns="http://www.web3d.org/specifications/x3d-namespace" ...>
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (17:16): That was unexpectedly straightforward
